Sentencas: Distribution of electrochemical reaction sites in a composite cathode of solid oxide fuel cell is investigated through active sites imaging by oxygen isotope labeling combined with three-dimensional microstructure observation by focused ion beam-scanning electron microscopy (FIB-SEM).
Titulo: Distribution of Reaction Sites in SOFC Cathode through Oxygen Isotope Labeling with Three-Dimensional Microstructural Analysis

Sentencas: Power generation with oxygen isotope and subsequent cell quenching is conducted at 973 K for LSM/YSZ cathode using a button cell.
Titulo: Distribution of Reaction Sites in SOFC Cathode through Oxygen Isotope Labeling with Three-Dimensional Microstructural Analysis

Sentencas: Through FIB-SEM observation and secondary ion mass spectroscopy (SIMS) analysis, the 3D microstructure of the quenched cathode with 2D O-18 concentration mapping in the middle plane of the characterized volume is obtained.
Titulo: Distribution of Reaction Sites in SOFC Cathode through Oxygen Isotope Labeling with Three-Dimensional Microstructural Analysis

Sentencas: Some LSM particles which show quite weak O-18 concentration are identified as the isolated phase, while several percolated LSMs near the electrolyte also show quite weak O-18 concentration, which indicates the existence of inactive reaction sites or ion/electron paths even inside the percolated phases.
Titulo: Distribution of Reaction Sites in SOFC Cathode through Oxygen Isotope Labeling with Three-Dimensional Microstructural Analysis

Sentencas: In addition, the oxide ion flux incorporated from the cathode/electrolyte interface is estimated from the O-18 concentration profiles at two locations in the observed area.
Titulo: Distribution of Reaction Sites in SOFC Cathode through Oxygen Isotope Labeling with Three-Dimensional Microstructural Analysis

Sentencas: A clear difference between the calculated oxide ion fluxes at the two locations is observed, which is discussed with the distributions of percolated TPB density and YSZ volume fraction in terms of the effective reaction thickness.
Titulo: Distribution of Reaction Sites in SOFC Cathode through Oxygen Isotope Labeling with Three-Dimensional Microstructural Analysis
